textfield.annotations: r0-11 { align: center; } r11-27 { align: center; }

textfield.text: Which of the following is valid? char alphabet = ‘1’; float f = 23.34; byte b = 23; int a = b; int x = 1; boolean y = x; short n=12;
Java is a programming language developed by Sun Microsystems (now a subsidiary of Oracle Corporation) in Year 1995

Following software need to be installed on local workstations: JDK1.6 Eclipse Java APIs Set up environment variables: JAVA_HOME PATH CLASSPATH Basic understanding of writing algorithms. No programming language experience required.
int i=10; This assigns the value on the right to variable on the left

~ inverts a bit pattern << shifts a bit pattern to the left >> shifts a bit pattern to the right >>> shifts a zero into the leftmost position & operator performs a bitwise AND operation ^ operator performs a bitwise exclusive OR operation | operator performs a bitwise inclusive OR operation
+ additive operator (also used for String concatenation) - subtraction operator * multiplication operator / division operator % remainder operator

+ Unary plus operator; indicates positive value - Unary minus operator; negates an expression ++ Increment operator; increments a value by 1 -- Decrement operator; decrements a value by 1 ! Logical complement operator; inverts the value of a boolean
== equal to != not equal to > greater than >= greater than or equal to < less than <= less than or equal to
Conditional Branching if if-else switch Looping Constructs in Java while do-while for Branching Statements break continue
50 keywords in Java No need to memorize them. You will get acquainted with them as you practice.

Our company requires a software which finds out - The number of years left for a person to retire. The program would be supplied with an array of birth years of the employees. The retirement age is 58 years The result will display the number of years left for active employment. Include checks for year values. (The year shouldn’t be a negative integer and it shouldn’t be a year in the future, etc..) Understand the following - Statements and Assignments of values to variables Conditional Statements Comparison Operators Looping Constructs

The company needs a program to add employees to a department. Write a program that takes two inputs from the user – Employee name and department number as String values. It then checks to validate if the department number entered is correct If yes, the employee is added to that department and a message is shown saying that the employee was added to the department <department_name>. If, no the user is prompted an error message and asked to enter the values again. There are following departments in the company : 1 – Networking, 2 – Accounts, 3 – Finance, 4 – Marketing, 5 – Technology Use the appropriate construct
To be done post learning Arrays

1. The most basic control flow statement supported by the Java programming language is the ___ statement. 2. The ___ statement allows for any number of possible execution paths. 3. The ___ statement is similar to the while statement, but evaluates its expression at the ___ of the loop. 4. How do you write an infinite loop using the for statement? 5. How do you write an infinite loop using the while statement? 6. Assume x=5 and y=10. What is the result of - (!(y==x)) - True/false ?
A package in java can be thought of as a folder structure that can help organize a set of related classes and interfaces together.

Classes are grouped into packages. Ex. ArrayList in java.util package System in java.lang package Full class name needs to be given to use a class. Ex. Java.util.ArrayList Alternatively, import the classes at the top. import java.util.ArrayList;

Object Creation Elephant elephant = new Elephant(); Constructors are used to set the values in instance variables or process anything required before an object can be used. The constructor name need to be same as class name. Constructor does not return anything. A class can have multiple overloaded constructors.
Real-world objects. Look around and identify objects: Student Instructor Chair Table Computer Duster Objects share two characteristics: They have state. They have behavior.
A class is a blueprint from which individual objects are created. For ex. All the people are built from the same set of blueprint and contain the same components.
textfield.annotations: r0-66 { align: left; } r67-163 { align: left; }

textfield.text: Write an Address class and print the address on output console. Demonstrate “AddressTest” example. Understand the following: Class and Object How to instantiate a class Test class Instance Variables and Methods Creating and using a constructor
Write an Employee class and print its emp id, name, project and address details. Demonstrate “EmployeeTest” example. Understand the following: How a class is called from other class.
Flexibility and Extensibility - No need to touch the code which is already tested But, Code is duplicated !!!
Object Oriented Programming is better because Based on real-life scenarios It is modular Easy to maintain and modify existing code
Things an object knows about itself Instance Variables (State) Things an object can do Methods (Behavior)

Following shapes are given – a square, a circle and a triangle. When the user clicks on a shape, the shape will rotate 360 degree clockwise and play a .mp3 sound file specific to that particular shape.

Questions Himself What this program needs to do? Which procedures do we need? Decides rotate and playSound procedures which will take shape as parameter. After all, a program is a pile of procedures. Starts Writing

Correction in Problem Statement: Rhombus was missed in the original Problem Statement. Rhombus shape needs to be handled a bit differently – when the user clicks on Rhombus, the shape will rotate 360 degree anti-clockwise and play a .avi file.
textfield.annotations: r0-34 { align: left; } r34-244 { align: left; }

textfield.text: Questions Himself What are the things in this program? Who are the key players? Decides The Shapes The User, Sound and Clicking event. Starts Writing
Questions Himself Which procedures needs to be changed? Decides To change both rotate and playSound method. Starts Writing

Write a program that will calculate the average score of 20 GMI trainees. Variables needed? int traineeAMarks; int traineeBMarks; int traineeCMarks; int traineeDMarks; --------- We need several variables at once. This will make the program difficult to manage.

A list of variables. Each variable in the list should be of the same type. A way to set the size of the list. A way to populate the list with each trainee’s score. A way to access the score of each trainee from the list.

In the above figure, ‘myArray’ is an array variable that is used to access the array elements. Each element in the array has a position or index. Values can be retrieved from array using index. Array index starts with zero in Java and the last index is [length-1]

Every element in an array is just a variable, a primitive variable or reference variable. An array of object reference variables, does not contain objects as the elements, but references to the actual objects that sit on the heap. Arrays are always objects whether they are declared to hold primitives or object references. An array of primitives is also an object.

Declare an integer array variable. int[] scores; Create a new integer array, with a capacity of 20 elements and assign it to the previously declared array variable. scores = new int[20]; Populate the array with trainees’ scores. Elements in an integer array are just integer variables. scores[0] = 65; scores[1] = 50; scores[2] = 80; scores[3] = 90; and so on till scores[19] = 75;

Array length is the number of elements it holds. This is defined when the array is initialized. Length or size of an array can be retrieved by myArray.length Note that length is an instance variable of the array object, not a method. There are no ()’s after the length. Once defined , the length of an array is fixed and cannot be increased to accommodate more elements.

Array can also be initialized by declaring it and giving values to elements in one line. int[] scores = {76, 55, 40, 95, 80}; String[] remarks = {“good”, “average”, “poor”}; The compiler will count the elements, allocate the space and fill it. In the above ‘scores’ array, scores.length will equal to 5. In ‘remarks’ array, remarks.length will equal to 3;
You can retrieve the array elements by going over the array starting from the first element till the last. This is called iterating over the array. Using a for loop:
for (int i = 0; i < scores.length; i++) { System.out.println(scores[i]); }
Primitives are simple bit patterns or fundamental values.
Variable of a given type cannot hold more than the maximum value range for that type.
Primitive declarations with assignments: int x = 34; boolean isFun = true; char c = ‘f’; double number = 323.42; float f = 24.42f; long num = 5555L;

These are like remote control which point to the actual objects in the heap. There is “no” such thing as an object variable. There is only an object “reference” variable. An object reference variable holds bits that represent a way to access an object.
Local variables are declared within a method.
Instance variables are declared inside a class but not within a method.
Variables must have DATA TYPE NAME
Variables have a size, which is determined by the data type.
It is used to hold certain values in a program.
int 0 float 0.0 boolean false References null
Instance variables always get a default value.
Local variables must be initialized before use. They do not get a default value.
textfield.annotations: r0-48 { align: left; } r48-80 { align: left; }

textfield.text: Write a program which accepts two employee objects; swaps them and prints their detail in the calling method. Demonstrate “SwapEmployee” example.

A class describes what an object knows and what an object does. Methods determine behavior of the class. Methods are the basic unit of work in object oriented programming. Every instance of a class has the same methods, but the methods can behave differently based on the values of the instance variables or based on parameter values passed into the method.

A method uses parameters. A caller passes arguments. Variables are passed by value in Java. That means “copy the value, and pass the copy”. A copy of the variable value is passed to the method. You can change that copy inside the method, but this will have no effect on the actual variable.

What happens when you pass an object instead of a primitive? An object reference variable is a reference to an object. So if you pass a reference to an object into a method, you are passing only a copy of the reference variable.

Draw the diagram of reference variable and the actual object variable for each step. Step#1 Employee e1 = new Employee(); Employee e2 = new Employee(); Step#2 Employee e3 = e1; Step#3 e1 = e2; Step#4 e3 =null;

The HR and finance department need a program which will increment the salary of an employee by desired %. Write a method which accepts an object of the Employee class(add a member variable in the employee class for storing employee’s salary) and % increment as parameters. It calculates the new salary after adding the increment and sets it in the employee object. The calling method should print the employee’s new salary.
Write a program that reads a series of 15 temperatures. Print them on console in the order they were entered. Print out the highest temperature. Print out the average of all temperatures.

The HR and finance department need a program which will increment the salary of an employee by desired %. Write a method which accepts the salary and % increment as parameters. It calculates the new salary after adding the increment and return it to the calling method. The calling method then prints the revised salary.
